title: The Competing Business Systems of Developing Asia
description: This course explores the major types of business systems prevalent in developing Asia. These include, for example, the state-owned enterprises of China, Chinese private sector firms, family-owned businesses of HK/Taiwan/SE Asia, Taiwanese tech firms, the Korean Chaebol, Indian promoter-led companies, and companies of developed markets that operate in the region. Course explores the nature of incentives, constraints, and decision making within these different types of firms. May not receive credit for GPIM 427 and IRGN 490. Competing Business Systems of Developing Asia.
